title: 8 Essential Tips from Figma for Designers Crafting Branded Templates in Buzz

paragraphs.content: Figma's official blog outlines eight practical tips for designers building branded templates in Figma Buzz, emphasizing responsive and modular designs to ensure brand consistency across assets and campaigns.Key strategies include using auto layout as the backbone for flexibility, separating text layers for scalability, and renaming layers descriptively like "Event Title" or "CTA Button Text."These guidelines help marketing teams create self-serve assets without breaking layouts, particularly for bulk creation via CSV or XLSX imports.

sections.title: Mastering Auto Layout and Layer Separation for Responsive Templates

paragraphs.content: Auto layout maintains consistent spacing in buttons, text boxes, and image containers, automatically adjusting for variable content like longer headlines.Separating text layers is crucial for Bulk Create functionality, where each data field maps to a specific layer to avoid formatting breaks.Descriptive naming, such as including examples like "Date of Event (e.g. July 10, 2025)," guides users on optimal formatting.

sections.title: Leveraging Variants and User Testing for Scalable Brand Control

paragraphs.content: Component variants allow swaps for logo orientations or icon styles via the inline toolbar, consolidating options into one set.Brand controls lock critical elements like logos while leaving text and images editable, indicated by pink outlines and limited panels.Video tutorials demonstrate publishing steps and best practices for social media assets.

Testing in a new Buzz file checks edit panels, layer clarity, and layout behavior with real content like long text or resized assets.Real-world examples from teams like Rippling highlight Buzz's role in efficient brand asset production.Guides position Buzz as superior to tools like Canva for consistent, faster workflows.
